Pre-Game Insights: New Zealand will lock horns with Pakistan on Saturday in a day match in the ICC Cricket World Cup 2023 at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru.
New Zealand will come into this match with a three-match losing streak, while Pakistan is coming off a win against Bangladesh after four successive losses.
The team that wins the match will bolster its chances of qualification for the semi-finals.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Intermittent cloud cover is expected in Bengaluru at the start of the game in the morning, with the temperature around 24°C.
There is around a 3-6% chance of rainfall, as the wind gusts will be blowing at a speed of 24-28 km/h.
The cloud cover will be nearly 73%, with humidity levels of around 86%.
During the afternoon, the weather will be mostly cloudy with a couple of showers and a thunderstorm with nearly 68% chances of precipitation.
The cloud cover is also likely to rise to 83%.
The wind will flow towards the east at a speed of 15 km/h.
The humidity levels will also soar to 75%.

The pitch at the Chinnaswamy is generally a belter, favouring the batters. However, in the last match played here, Sri Lanka bowled out England for a score of 156, as fast bowlers picked up seven wickets.
Others: Probable Playing XI for New Zealand: Devon Conway, Will Young, Rachin Ravindra, Daryl Mitchell, Tom Latham (c & wk), Glenn Phillips, James Neesham, Mitchell Santner, Tim Southee, Lockie Ferguson, Trent Boult.

Probable Playing XI for Pakistan: Fakhar Zaman, Abdullah Shafique, Babar Azam (c), Mohammad Rizwan (wk), Saud Shakeel, Iftikhar Ahmed, Salman Ali Agha, Usama Mir, Mohammad Wasim Jr., Shaheen Afridi, Haris Rauf.
